page.title: 13Andover Pr. School, Brechin
page.content: Andover School was built in 1859.There is an Annexe as well as the main building.The main building contains classes 4-7.The Annexe contains classes 1-3.The main building has a clock tower which has 4 faces.Andover is in the South-East of the town.There is a School house but it is used as a resources room, printing room and a paper store. Mrs MacIntosh is the school secretary she prints things for the school like notes for the parents.The corridors are narrow and there are pegs on the wall.The walls are made of half wood and half plaster so pin boards are essential.The ceilings are high and the radiators are clumsy. Class 4-5 is composite.There is a library area and we have sinks throughout the school.There was some repair to the ceilings last year.
